page.title: 07Local Church and Graveyard
page.content: The church in Aberlour dates back to 600 A D, when the monk St. Drostan founded a church there. The present church is situated in The Square and dates back to 1812. It was gutted by fire in 1861, leaving only the belfry tower standing. Some of the stones blackened by the fire can still be seen in the North wall. Since then, it has suffered two outbreaks of dry rot, in 1932 and again in 1983. It has three stained glass windows, all designed by the same person. In the old part of the graveyard, can be seen the gable end of the earliest church to serve the parish of Aberlour.Set in the wall is one of the oldest legible stones dated 1664. Buried in the graveyard is Hare, who with his partner Burke were notorious grave robbers in the early 19th.C.
